body:
`tensor.device(...)` and `tensor.device_of(...)` is compact and similar to `tensor.cuda()` / `tensor.cpu()`.

If you dont like that, `tensor.to_device(...)` and `tensor.to_device_of(...)` make more sense.
`on_device` is definitely not great.
